subject: Re: [junit] Re: Non Plus Ultra Coverage Measure?
msgSnippet: ... Imagine test cases without a single assert statement. What does 100% coverage (of any coverage measure) tell you? Nothing except that all covered paths can
messageBody:
> You are right with the 100% objection. I meant a measure which
> covers everything. If all tests are written to the results of that
> measure and the tests are all green then I think it is proven that
> there are no bugs in the code (if the test has no bugs itself).

Imagine test cases without a single assert statement. What does 100%
coverage (of any coverage measure) tell you? Nothing except that all covered paths
can be executed. But they don't tell you if the execution of those paths
produce the right results.

Johannes
